content:
Could people express their opinion on where the NormalizedGCDMonoid ℤ instance (currently called docs#Int.instNormalizedGCDMonoidIntToCancelCommMonoidWithZeroInstCommSemiringIsDomainToLinearOrderedSemiringToLinearOrderedCommSemiringInstLinearOrderedCommRingExistsAddOfLEInstAddGroupToLEToPreorderToPartialOrderToStrictOrderedSemiring, mind fixing @Ruben Van de Velde?) should be moved to? Options are

  • A new Algebra.GCDMonoid.Int file
  • The existing file#Algebra/GCDMonoid/Nat which could then be renamed to Algebra.GCDMonoid.NatInt

My preference is for the latter because I suspect there are quite a few theorems to be proved at the intersection of the two files, and no import consideration is stopping us from merging them. Ruben's preference is for the former.
In other words, what are the benefits of merging the two files?
Having no natural location for the theorems that need both? cf my above message

Yaël Dillies said:

My preference is for the latter because I suspect there are quite a few theorems to be proved at the intersection of the two files, and no import consideration is stopping us from merging them. Ruben's preference is for the former.

Mine is for the latter, it seems more natural.
Do you have concrete things in mind that would be in the intersection?
Nat.cast (gcd a b) = gcd a b for example
